title: Lissajous Curves: Where Mathematics Meets Music and Light
description: A 19th-century physicist pointed lasers at tuning forks and created one of the most useful patterns in engineering. Turns out the same math connects musical harmony, graphic design, and the LIDAR in your car. A full explanation of the theory begind it, plus an interactive tool to make your own.

title: How Many Tokens Does Humanity Speak Per Year?
description: How many tokens do the biggest AI labs process every year? How does that compare to humanity's spoken words?

title: Building a Carousel
description: Tips & tricks behind my custom carousel

title: How Marketing Renames Our World
description: Some words we regularly use have really fun origins, far from a simple etymology perspective

title: Motivation - A personal take
description: A small self-reflection on what motivation is to me.

title: Was maths invented or discovered?
description: An exploration of the philosophy of mathematics and its origins.

title: The art of stressing
description: Understanding stress: where it comes from and how to find balance in a hectic world.

title: How China Quietly Caught Up
description: Why everyone chooses China as their manufacturing hub? Is China really on the verge of surpassing the US in AI?

title: Interactive Pixel Grid
description: A fun experiment with a pixel grid that responds to user interaction.

title: Animated Avatar
